text: PRELIMINARY DRAFT PHASE II PERMIT FOR EASTERN WASHINGTON
label: HH1

text: Appendix 4
label: BODY

text: Page 1 of 5
label: BODY

text: APPENDIX 4 – Required Implementation Schedule
label: HH1

text: This Appendix is provided only as a reference tool for the Permittees.  In the event of a
label: BODY

text: discrepancy, the body of the Permit shall provide the required details of implementation of a
label: BODY

text: particular action by a Permittee, and the date and/or description in this Appendix shall be
label: BODY

text: disregarded.
label: BODY

text: All Permittees
label: HH1

text: No later than March 31 each year beginning in 2007:
label: BODY

text: Submit an annual report covering the previous calendar year.
label: BODY

text: For the duration of coverage under this Permit:
label: BODY

text: Keep all records related to this permit and the SWMP for at least five years.
label: BODY

text: Primary Permittees and Co-Permittees
label: HH1

text: No later than the effective date of this permit:
label: BODY

text: Submit a Notice of Intent for permit coverage for all projects owned or operated by the
label: BODY

text: Permittee that are required to be covered under the General NPDES Permit for
label: BODY

text: Stormwater Discharges Associated with Construction Activities.
label: BODY

text: Identify, and submit a Notice of Intent for permit coverage for, all facilities owned or
label: BODY

text: operated by the Permittee that are required to be covered under the General NPDES
label: BODY

text: Permit for Stormwater Discharges Associated with Industrial Activities.
label: BODY

text: From the effective date of this permit:
label: BODY

text: Provide information to design professionals about training available on how to comply
label: BODY

text: with the requirements of Appendix 2 and apply the BMPs described in the Stormwater
label: BODY

text: Management Manual for Eastern Washington, or an equivalent document.
label: BODY

text: Include construction and post-construction controls selected and implemented pursuant to
label: BODY

text: the requirements in Appendix 2 on all public projects approved after this date.
label: BODY

text: Conduct spot checks for potentially damaged stormwater treatment and flow control
label: BODY

text: facilities after major storm events (greater than 10-year recurrence interval rainfall).
label: BODY

text: No later than May 31 each year beginning in 2007:
label: BODY

text: Make the latest updated version of the SWMP available to the public on the Permittee’s
label: BODY

text: website or submit the updated SWMP in electronic format to the Department no later
label: BODY

text: than April 30 for posting on the Department’s website.
label: BODY

text: No later than one year from the effective date of this permit:
label: BODY

text: Adopt a program or policy directive to create opportunities for the public to participate in
label: BODY

text: the decision making processes involving the development, implementation and update of
label: BODY

text: the Permittee’s SWMP, including development and adoption of all required ordinances.
label: BODY

text: PRELIMINARY DRAFT PHASE II PERMIT FOR EASTERN WASHINGTON
label: HH1

text: Appendix 4
label: BODY

text: Page 2 of 5
label: BODY

text: Develop and implement a process for consideration of public comments on the SWMP,
label: BODY

text: including required ordinances.
label: BODY

text: No later than two years from the effective date of this permit:
label: BODY

text: Publicize a hotline or other local telephone number for public reporting of spills and other
label: BODY

text: illicit discharges; keep a record of all calls received and of all follow-up actions taken.
label: BODY

text: Develop and adopt an ordinance or other regulatory mechanism to require erosion and
label: BODY

text: sediment controls at new development and redevelopment projects.
label: BODY

text: Develop and adopt an ordinance or other regulatory mechanism that requires post-
label: BODY

text: construction stormwater controls at new development and redevelopment projects.
label: BODY

text: Beginning two years from the effective date of this Permit:
label: BODY

text: Inspect structural BMPs at least once during installation and at least once every five years
label: BODY

text: after final installation, or more frequently as determined by the Permittee to be necessary
label: BODY

text: to prevent adverse water quality impacts, to ensure adequate maintenance is being
label: BODY

text: performed.
label: BODY

text: No later than three years from the effective date of this permit:
label: BODY

text: Identify and characterize target audiences within the jurisdiction to meet the education
label: BODY

text: and outreach goals of the SWMP.
label: BODY

text: Complete at least one third of a map of the MS4, showing the location of all known
label: BODY

text: outfalls and the names and locations of all waters of the state that receive discharges from
label: BODY

text: those outfalls.
label: BODY

text: Develop and implement a schedule of municipal operation and maintenance activities (an
label: BODY

text: O&M Plan).
label: BODY

text: Inspect all stormwater treatment and flow control facilities owned or operated by the
label: BODY

text: Permittee at least once.
label: BODY

text: No later than four years from the effective date of this permit:
label: BODY

text: Complete at least two thirds of a map of the MS4, showing the location of all known
label: BODY

text: outfalls and the names and locations of all waters of the state that receive discharges from
label: BODY

text: those outfalls.
label: BODY

text: Identify priorities for evaluating the effectiveness of their SWMP in each of the following
label: BODY

text: areas:  Runoff treatment BMPs; Flow control BMPs; Source control BMPs; Land use
label: BODY

text: characterization; Stormwater quality and/or toxicity; Receiving water quality.
label: BODY

text: By the expiration date of this permit:
label: BODY

text: Develop and implement a public education and outreach strategy that meets the goals of
label: BODY

text: the SWMP.
label: BODY

text: Complete a map of the MS4, showing the location of all known outfalls and the names
label: BODY

text: and locations of all waters of the state that receive discharges from those outfalls.
label: BODY

text: Conduct field surveys to verify locations and identify previously unknown outfalls on
label: BODY

text: priority water bodies.
label: BODY

text: PRELIMINARY DRAFT PHASE II PERMIT FOR EASTERN WASHINGTON
label: HH1

text: Appendix 4
label: BODY

text: Page 3 of 5
label: BODY

text: Adopt an ordinance or other regulatory mechanism that prohibits illicit discharges and
label: BODY

text: authorizes enforcement actions, including on private property.
label: BODY

text: Develop and fully implement an ongoing program to detect and address non-stormwater
label: BODY

text: discharges, including illegal dumping, to the MS4.
label: BODY

text: Distribute appropriate information to target audiences identified in the public outreach
label: BODY

text: strategy.
label: BODY

text: Adopt procedures for site plan review which incorporate consideration of potential water
label: BODY

text: quality impacts.
label: BODY

text: Provide information to construction operators about training available on how to install
label: BODY

text: and maintain effective erosion and sediment controls and how to comply with the
label: BODY

text: requirements of Appendix 2 and apply the BMPs described in Chapter 7 of the
label: BODY

text: Stormwater Management Manual for Eastern Washington, or an equivalent document.
label: BODY

text: Adopt procedures for site plan review of post-construction stormwater controls which
label: BODY

text: incorporate consideration of potential water quality impacts.
label: BODY

text: Adopt procedures for site inspection and enforcement of control measures.
label: BODY

text: Provide adequate training for all staff involved in permitting, planning, review,
label: BODY

text: inspection, and enforcement to carry out the provisions of the Post-Construction SWMP
label: BODY

text: component.
label: BODY

text: Implement catch basin cleaning, stormwater system maintenance, scheduled structural
label: BODY

text: BMP inspections and maintenance, and pollution prevention/good housekeeping
label: BODY

text: practices.
label: BODY

text: Implement all pollution prevention/good housekeeping practices established in the O&M
label: BODY

text: Plan for roads, highways, and parking lots owned, operated, or maintained by the
label: BODY

text: Permittee.
label: BODY

text: Conduct all vehicle and equipment washing and maintenance in a self-contained covered
label: BODY

text: building or in designated wash and/or maintenance areas operated to separate wash water
label: BODY

text: from stormwater.
label: BODY

text: Implement all pollution prevention/good housekeeping practices established in the O&M
label: BODY

text: Plan for buildings owned, operated, or maintained by the Permittee.
label: BODY

text: Implement park and open space maintenance pollution prevention/good housekeeping
label: BODY

text: practices at all park areas and other open spaces owned or operated by the Permittee.
label: BODY

text: Develop and implement a Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plan to protect water quality
label: BODY

text: at each of these facilities owned or operated by the Permittee and not covered under the
label: BODY

text: General NPDES Permit for Stormwater Discharges Associated with Industrial Activities.
label: BODY

text: Implement provisions to address water quality considerations in the design of all new
label: BODY

text: flood management projects, including use of controls that minimize impacts to site
label: BODY

text: hydrology and still meet project objectives; existing flood management projects shall be
label: BODY

text: prioritized and at least five shall be reviewed and evaluated to determine whether changes
label: BODY

text: or additions should be made to improve water quality.
label: BODY

text: PRELIMINARY DRAFT PHASE II PERMIT FOR EASTERN WASHINGTON
label: HH1

text: Appendix 4
label: BODY

text: Page 4 of 5
label: BODY

text: Identify other facilities that that would reasonably be expected to discharge contaminated
label: BODY

text: runoff, include BMPs to protect water quality from discharges from these sites in the
label: BODY

text: O&M Plan, and implement the BMPs.
label: BODY

text: Inspect all stormwater treatment and flow control facilities owned or operated by the
label: BODY

text: Permittee at least twice.
label: BODY

text: Train all employees whose construction, operations, or maintenance job functions may
label: BODY

text: impact stormwater quality.
label: BODY

text: Secondary Permittees
label: HH1

text: From the date of permit coverage:
label: BODY

text: Comply with all relevant ordinances, rules, and regulations of the local jurisdiction(s) in
label: BODY

text: which the Secondary Permittee is located that govern construction phase stormwater
label: BODY

text: pollution prevention measures.
label: BODY

text: Seek coverage under the General NPDES Permit for Stormwater Discharges Associated
label: BODY

text: with Construction Activities for all sites with land disturbance greater than one acre and
label: BODY

text: discharge to surface water either directly or via a MS4.
label: BODY

text: Provide training or coordinate with existing training efforts to educate relevant staff in
label: BODY

text: erosion and sediment control BMPs and requirements, or hire trained contractors to
label: BODY

text: perform the work.
label: BODY

text: Coordinate, as requested, with the Department or the local jurisdiction to provide access
label: BODY

text: for inspection of construction sites or other land disturbances greater than one acre under
label: BODY

text: the control of the Secondary Permittee during the active grading and/or construction
label: BODY

text: period.
label: BODY

text: Comply with all relevant ordinances, rules and regulations of the local jurisdiction(s) in
label: BODY

text: which the Secondary Permittee is located that govern post-construction stormwater
label: BODY

text: pollution prevention measures, including proper operation and maintenance of the MS4.
label: BODY

text: Provide for the post-construction stormwater controls included in Appendix 2 to be
label: BODY

text: included on all new construction and other land-disturbing projects greater than one acre
label: BODY

text: and ensure that qualified staff or contractors design post-construction stormwater controls
label: BODY

text: as necessary to protect water quality on those projects.
label: BODY

text: Comply with all relevant ordinances, rules, and regulations of the local jurisdiction(s) in
label: BODY

text: which the Secondary Permittee is located that govern non-stormwater discharges.
label: BODY

text: No later than one year from the date of permit coverage:
label: BODY

text: Develop and enforce appropriate policies prohibiting illicit discharges and illegal
label: BODY

text: dumping; identify possible enforcement mechanisms.
label: BODY

text: Develop and implement a municipal operation and maintenance (O&M) plan.
label: BODY

text: No later than eighteen months from the date of permit coverage:
label: BODY

text: Develop and implement an enforcement plan using the enforcement mechanisms
label: BODY

text: identified during the first year to ensure compliance with illicit discharge policies.
label: BODY

text: PRELIMINARY DRAFT PHASE II PERMIT FOR EASTERN WASHINGTON
label: HH1

text: Appendix 4
label: BODY

text: Page 5 of 5
label: BODY

text: No later than two years from the date of permit coverage:
label: BODY

text: Develop and implement procedures to identify and remove any illicit discharges
label: BODY

text: discovered during inspections.
label: BODY

text: Each year, conduct field inspections and visually inspect for illicit discharges during dry
label: BODY

text: weather at one third (on average) of all known outfalls that discharge to surface waters.
label: BODY

text: Visually inspect at least all known outfalls.
label: BODY

text: No later than three years from the date of permit coverage:
label: BODY

text: Identify at least one target audience for stormwater education.
label: BODY

text: No later than four years from the date of permit coverage:
label: BODY

text: Develop a public outreach strategy to provide appropriate information to the target
label: BODY

text: audience about proper stormwater management to prevent water quality impacts.
label: BODY

text: During the final year of the permit term:
label: BODY

text: Implement the public outreach strategy.
label: BODY

text: Before the expiration date of this permit:
label: BODY

text: Publish a public notice in the local newspaper and solicit public review of the SWMP.
label: BODY

text: Make the latest updated version of the SWMP available to the public on the Permittee’s
label: BODY

text: website or submit the updated SWMP in electronic format to the Department for posting
label: BODY

text: on the Department’s website.
label: BODY

text: Develop a storm sewer system map showing all known storm drain outfalls and receiving
label: BODY

text: waters and delineating the areas contributing runoff to each outfall.
label: BODY

text: Develop and implement a spill response plan that includes coordination with a qualified
label: BODY

text: spill responder.
label: BODY

text: Provide staff training or coordinate with existing training efforts to educate all relevant
label: BODY

text: staff on proper best management practices for preventing spills and illicit discharges.
label: BODY

text: Identify areas of industrial activity within the Secondary Permittee’s MS4 service area
label: BODY

text: that require coverage under the General NPDES Permit for Stormwater Discharges
label: BODY

text: Associated with Industrial Activities, determine whether coverage has been obtained, and
label: BODY

text: inform the Department if coverage has not been obtained.
label: BODY

text: Train all employees whose construction, operations, or maintenance job functions may
label: BODY

text: impact stormwater quality in the areas of: the importance of protecting water quality; the
label: BODY

text: requirements of this permit; operation and maintenance requirements; inspection
label: BODY

text: procedures; ways to perform their job activities to prevent or minimize impacts to water
label: BODY

text: quality; and procedures for reporting water quality concerns, including potential illicit
label: BODY

text: discharges.
label: BODY
